thread.title: Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years
thread.title_full: Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years

author: FRED GOODALL
title: Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years
text:
Brian Blanco Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years 
Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback Jameis Winston celebrates as he leaves the field following a 38-30 win over the Jacksonville Jaguars during an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Brian Blanco) Corey Perrine Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years 
Jacksonville Jaguars quarterback Blake Bortles (5) throws during the second half of an NFL football game against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Tampa, Fla. (Corey Perrine/Naples Daily News via AP) FORT MYERS OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT Brian Blanco Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years 
Jacksonville Jaguars wide receiver Allen Robinson (15) beats Tampa Bay Buccaneers cornerback Tim Jennings (28) on a 5-yard touchdown reception during the fourth quarter of an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Brian Blanco) Corey Perrine Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years 
Tampa Bay Buccaneers running back Doug Martin (22) runs for a touchdown against the Jacksonville Jaguars during the first half of an NFL football game, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Tampa, Fla. (Corey Perrine/Naples Daily News via AP) FORT MYERS OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT Corey Perrine Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years 
Jacksonville Jaguars wide receiver Allen Hurns (88) left celebrates a touchdown with tight end Marcedes Lewis (89) during the first half of an NFL football game against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Tampa, Fla. (Corey Perrine/Naples Daily News via AP) FORT MYERS OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT Posted: Sunday, October 11, 2015 11:48 pm Bucs hold off Jaguars for first home win in nearly 2 years Associated Press | 
TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — It had been a while since they celebrated an NFL win in Tampa Bay. 
Jameis Winston played the role of game manager, and Doug Martin took pressure off the rookie quarterback by gashing one of the NHL's top run defenses for 123 yards rushing as the Buccaneers beat the Jacksonville Jaguars 38-31 on Sunday for their first regular season victory at home in nearly two years.
